channel.title: Need help getting compile to work
channel.description:
hey guys, i recently just got my new desktop with windows vista and i used to have a 32 bit windows xp. so im trying to get the compile to work on this new computer... any help would be awesome! heres the what compile looks like.. [code]@echo off title compile cd ../src echo Compiling net/com/pulsepk/*.java "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -cp . -d ../build/ ./net/com/pulsepk/*.java pause[/code]
i thought this would work but i am getting some error like this - unrecognized option: -d could not create the virtual java machine. press any key to continue...

item.title: Need help getting compile to work
item.dc:creator: @xhunterzx xhunterzx
item.description:
@xhunterzx wrote:

yay lol it worked

Read full topic

item.title: Need help getting compile to work
item.dc:creator: @fashofasho fashofasho
item.description:
@fashofasho wrote:

aight lol my bad… this is weird i thought i had installed java jdk 22 and i just checked i installed jre… so i just installed jdk and now its working lol…
Thanks to all of you, really appreciate that help (:

Read full topic

item.source: Need help getting compile to work

item.title: Need help getting compile to work
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Okay…

@echo off
title compile
cd …/src
echo Compiling net/com/pulsepk/.java
[shadow=blue,right]“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe”[/shadow] -cp . -d …/build/ ./net/com/pulsepk/.java
pause

The highlighted part has to match your path to javac.exe, if it doesn’t you will continue to get the The system cannot find the path specified. message.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help getting compile to work
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

In the batch file, replace

"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe"

with

"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\javac.exe"

You seem to be making things more complicated than they have to be.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help getting compile to work
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

That would be because javac is not included in JRE, its included in JDK. That path is for JRE.
